article: My father brought home a sailboat when I was ten, and almost each Sunday in summers we would go sailing. Dad was quite skilled in sailing, but not good at  _  . When we were in the middle of the lake, a  _  wind came all of a sudden. The boat was hit  _  . Dad was always at his best in any  _  , but at this moment he  _  . Upon sitting on the hull, Dad was a little awkward about his flash of  _  . "It's all right, Dad. We are safe now," I comforted him. That was the first time Dad had counted on me in a moment of emergency. More importantly, I found it was my turn to start  looking out  for my father.
